reviewText: This is a good history of medical advancements by individual doctors.
This is a superb course taught by a well respected physician and author.  If you have any interest in medical history, you will find these lectures worth watching.

It is hard for me to stomach the professor's coldness toward the vivisection that most of these doctors performed. I know full well that experiments on live animals happened, and it's important to include that in the course. But the professor treated vivisection as if it is a controversy-free, harmless tool that makes the world wonderful.

For instance, his description of cutting open a mammal and watching "its" heart slowing as "it" died is chilling, and he doesn't seem to realize that it's anything but fascinating. It really turned me off of this course.

This is an excellent video for any students entering the medical field. I am a student of Oriental Medicine and I am interested in the history of medicine and this does a supurb job with western medine.
